questions.question: What you did …………………. wrong.
questions.description: Here the subject is the noun clause 'what you did'. When the subject is a clause, the verb is singular.

questions.question: Walk carefully lest you ………………….. slip.
questions.description: Should is the only auxiliary that can be used after lest.

questions.question: I was not invited …………………….. her birthday party.
If he had received medical attention in time, he ………………………
questions.description: In the third conditional we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: Which of the following words does not have a plural form?
Trespassing is prohibited. Here trespassing is a ………………….
questions.description: When an -ing form is used as a subject, it is a gerund.

questions.question: Nobody came, ……………………?
questions.description: Use an affirmative tag after negative expressions like nobody and hardly.

questions.question: Neither the manager nor his secretary ……………………. present.
To smell a rat is to ………………….
Send this letter by registered post. Change into passive
answers: Letter be sent by registered post
Let this letter be sent by registered post
Letter should be spent by registered post
